entries.name: mapKeys

manifest.summary: Constructs a new object where each key in `obj` has been mapped by `fn` to a new key.

entries.description:
# Parameters

- `obj`

  The object to be processed

- `fn`

  A callback that will be called with each key in the object. This function should return a transformed key that will be used to construct the new object. The callback accepts the following parameters:

  - `key`: The current key to transform.

# Examples

```
> mapKeys({key1: 2, key2: 3}, k => `prefix_${k}`)
{prefix_key1: 2, prefix_key2: 3}
```

# Additional Information

Any attributes in `obj`'s prototype will be ignored.

entries.name: mapValues

manifest.summary: Constructs a new object where each value in `obj` has been mapped by `fn` to a new value.

entries.description:
# Parameters

- `obj`

  The object to be processed

- `fn`

  A callback that will be called with each value in the object. This function should return a transformed value that will be used to construct the new object. The callback accepts the following parameters:

  - `value`: The current value to transform.

# Examples

```
> mapValues({a: 2, b: 3}, x => x**2)
{a: 4, b: 9}
```

# Additional Information

Any attributes in `obj`'s prototype will be ignored.

entries.name: invert

manifest.summary: Constructs a new object that maps `obj`'s values to its keys.

entries.description:
# Parameters

- `obj`

  The object to invert.

# Examples

```
> invert({five: '5', six: '6'})
{5: "five", 6: "six"}
```

# Additional Information

Any attributes in `obj`'s prototype will be ignored.

entries.name: intersection

manifest.summary: Returns an array of elements that exist in both `array1` and `array2`
Returns an array of elements that are in `array1` but not in `array2`.

entries.name: zip

manifest.summary: Allows iterating over multiple arrays at the same time.

entries.name: truncate

manifest.summary: Truncates `str` and append an ellipse when it's length exceeds `maxSize`

entries.name: trim

manifest.summary: Trims characters from both ends of the string `str` that are found in the string `toRemove`.

entries.name: trimLeft

manifest.summary: Trims characters from the left end of the string `str` that are found in the string `toRemove`.

entries.name: trimRight

manifest.summary: Trims characters from the right end of the string `str` that are found in the string `toRemove`.

entries.name: randomInt

manifest.summary: Returns a random integer between `min` and `max` (but not including `max`).

entries.name: shuffle

manifest.summary: Returns a copy of `array` that has been shuffled.

entries.name: el
entries.description:
# Parameters - `tagName` The new element's tag - `attrs` A mapping of attribute names to values - `children` A list of child nodes. A child can either be a string, or an HTML element (e.g. one generated by el()) # Examples ``` el('div', { id: 'my-div' }, [ el('span', {}, ['Hello']), 'World!', ]) /* The above results in the following HTML structure
Hello World!
*/ ```

entries.name: fragment
entries.description: # Parameters - `children` A list of child nodes. A child can either be a string, or an HTML element (e.g. one generated by el()) # Examples ``` fragment([ // Using the el() snap.js function in this example. el('span', {}, ['Hello']), 'World!', ]) /* The above results in the following HTML structure Hello World! */ ```

entries.name: memoize

manifest.summary: Returns a memoized version of `fn`. The results of calling the returned function gets cached, so when it's called again with the same arguments, the cached result will be returned.

entries.name: createEventEmitter

manifest.summary: Creates a simple eventEmitter instance to aid with the pub-sub pattern of subscribing to events and notifying subscribers.

entries.name: addToDate

manifest.summary: Returns a new date with year/month/day offsets added the `date`
